intro: Drimys pancheri, commonly known as the Pancher's woodruff, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Winteraceae, which is one of the oldest plant families, characterized by its primitive floral structures. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and aromatic. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late winter to early spring, making it a rare early-flowering species. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts used traditionally in local remedies.
